info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 4 at 1:59AM MST until September 4 at 3:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa.
* WHEN...Until 300 AM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 159 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Woodchopper Wash, Star Wash, Delaney Wash, Jackrabbit Wash, Dead Horse Wash, Fourmile Wash, Old Camp Wash, Winters Wash, Coyote Wash and Beer Bottle Wash. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tonopah. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING
